Description¶

Create context managers for use in Maya.

Usage¶

Context managers are used to encapsulate a code block in a specific context. They allow for a temporary state to exist while code is being executed and are initialised as follows:

with Context(args):
    completeActionsWithinContext()
class msTools.core.maya.context_utils.DisableCycleChecks¶

Bases: object

Context manager for temporarily disabling cycle checks.

Designed for situations where a benign cycle is known to momentarily occur. Should not be used to supress warnings resulting from malign cycles.

__init__()¶

Initialize the context.

class msTools.core.maya.context_utils.DisableFilePrompting¶

Bases: object

Context manager for temporarily disabling file prompting.

Note

File prompting dialogs include error messages that require user confirmation and missing file reference dialogs.

__init__()¶

Initialize the context.

class msTools.core.maya.context_utils.DisableUndoQueue(flush=True)¶

Bases: object

Context manager for temporarily disabling the undo queue.

__init__(flush=True)¶

Initialize the context by specifying whether the undo queue will be flushed upon entering the context.

Warning

Performing destructive operations whilst the undo queue is disabled and unflushed can produce an unstable state once the queue is re-enabled. Maya may be unable to properly reconstruct the former state of the scene when undoing operations that try to bypass some destructive action.

Parameters:flush (bool, optional) – If True, flush the undo queue upon entering the context, otherwise leave the queue unflushed. Defaults to True.
class msTools.core.maya.context_utils.RestoreSelection¶

Bases: object

Context manager for restoring an initial selection after completing some actions which affect the active selection list.

__init__()¶

Initialize the context.

class msTools.core.maya.context_utils.SetActiveNamespace(namespace)¶

Bases: object

Context manager for temporarily changing the active namespace.

Useful if you want to create some nodes and have them automatically assigned to a namespace.

__init__(namespace)¶

Initialize the context with a namespace to activate upon entering.

Parameters:namespace (basestring) –

Absolute or relative namespace.

  • If absolute, a leading ':' representing the root namespace must be used.
  • If relative, namespace must be a child of the current namespace.
class msTools.core.maya.context_utils.SetActiveUnit(angle=None, linear=None, time=None)¶

Bases: object

Context manager for temporarily changing the current units.

__init__(angle=None, linear=None, time=None)¶

Initialize the context with units to set upon entering.

Only unit types with non-None values will be changed upon entering the context.

Parameters:
  • angle (basestring, optional) – Set the current angular unit. Valid values are 'deg', 'degree', 'rad', 'radian'. Defaults to None.
  • linear (basestring, optional) – Set the current linear unit. Valid values are 'mm', 'millimeter', 'cm', 'centimeter', 'm', 'meter', 'km', 'kilometer', 'in', 'inch', 'ft', 'foot', 'yd', 'yard', 'mi', 'mile'. Defaults to None.
  • time (basestring, optional) – Set the current time unit. Valid values are 'hour', 'min', 'sec', 'millisec', 'game', 'film', 'pal', 'ntsc', 'show', 'palf', 'ntscf', '23.976fps', '29.97fps', '29.97df', '47.952fps', '59.94fps', '44100fps', '48000fps'. Defaults to None.
class msTools.core.maya.context_utils.Undo¶

Bases: object

Context manager for encapsulating Maya commands in a chunk which will be undone upon exiting the context. Mostly useful for testing purposes.

Note

The chunk is undone regardless of any exceptions raised whilst inside the context.

__init__()¶

Initialize the context.

class msTools.core.maya.context_utils.UndoChunk¶

Bases: object

Context manager for encapsulating Maya commands in an undoable chunk.

__init__()¶

Initialize the context.

class msTools.core.maya.context_utils.UndoItOnError(modifier, *excTypes)¶

Bases: object

Context manager for calling the undoIt() method on a given Maya modifier instance if certain types of unhandled exceptions are raised from within the context.

__init__(modifier, *excTypes)¶

Initialize the context with exception types to catch when entered.

Parameters:
  • modifier (T) – Any instance of some generic type T which conforms to Maya’s modifier interface. Specifically implementation of T.doIt() and T.undoIt() methods are required. Examples of valid types T are OpenMaya.MDGModifier, OpenMaya.MDagModifier, U <= msTools.core.maya.om_utils.Modifier.
  • *excTypes – Sequence of class types which are (non-strict) subclasses of BaseException. Unhandled exceptions of these types or any subtypes will result in the invocation of modifier.undoIt() before the exception is propagated further.
class msTools.core.maya.context_utils.UndoOnError(*excTypes)¶

Bases: object

Context manager for encapsulating Maya commands in a chunk which will be undone if certain types of unhandled exceptions are raised from within the context.

__init__(*excTypes)¶

Initialize the context with exception types to catch when entered.

Parameters:*excTypes – Sequence of class types which are (non-strict) subclasses of BaseException. Unhandled exceptions of these types or any subtypes will result in all encapsulated operations being undone before the exception is propagated further.
class msTools.core.maya.context_utils.UnlockNode(node)¶

Bases: object

Context manager for temporarily unlocking a dependency node.

Note

Instantiated contexts are designed to be entered immediately. The user must ensure the encapsulated dependency node remains valid.

__init__(node)¶

Intialize the context with a dependency node to unlock upon entering.

Parameters:node (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a dependency node.
Raises:msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If node does not reference a dependency node.
class msTools.core.maya.context_utils.UnlockPlug(plug)¶

Bases: object

Context manager for temporarily unlocking a plug.

Note

In order to globally unlock a plug, any internally locked ancestor plug will also be unlocked.

Instantiated contexts are designed to be entered immediately. The user must ensure the encapsulated dependency node plug remains valid.

__init__(plug)¶

Intialize the context with a plug to unlock upon entering.

Parameters:plug (OpenMaya.MPlug) – Encapsulation of a dependency node plug.
